patterns: What is the primary goal of Software Quality Assurance (SQA)?
responses: The primary goal of Software Quality Assurance is : Ensuring the software meets quality standards, If you have more question ask

patterns: What is the main objective of software testing?
responses: The main objective of software testing is finding defects and ensuring quality,If you have more question ask

patterns:
Which of the following is NOT a role of a QA tester?
a) Writing code
b) Creating test cases
c) Executing test cases
d) Reviewing requirements
responses: Writing code is NOT a role of a QA tester

patterns: What phase of the software development life cycle comes after testing?
responses: Development phase comes after testing in SDLC

patterns: Which SDLC model is known for its sequential and linear approach?
The main objective of software testing is to ensure 100% bug-free software. Is this true or false?
Testers are responsible for writing code as part of their role. Is this true or false
System testing focuses on verifying individual components of the software. Is this true or false
Test automation eliminates the need for manual testing. Is this true or false
Acceptance testing is performed to validate whether the software meets user needs. Is this true or false

Which of the following are goals of software testing? (Select all that apply)
a) To ensure the software is 100% defect-free
b) To verify that the software meets requirements
c) To improve software quality and reliability
d) To identify defects and weaknesses in the software

Which testing level focuses on evaluating the software to ensure it meets user requirements?
a) Unit testing
b) Integration testing
c) System testing
d) Acceptance testing
Answer: c, d

What is the purpose of test automation in software testing? (Select all that apply)
a) To replace manual testers
b) To increase test coverage and efficiency
c) To eliminate the need for defect management
d) To reduce the need for test planning

Which type of testing focuses on assessing how well the software performs under various load conditions? (Select all that apply)
a) Load testing
b) Performance testing
c) Security testing
d) Usability testing

What is the primary goal of acceptance testing? (Select all that apply)
a) To validate that the software meets user needs
b) To verify that the software works on all platforms
c) To ensure that all code changes are integrated
d) To assess the software's performance under stress
